TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RoleGroup extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Associates a content template in a control with one or more roles defined for the Web site. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to define a set of content templates that contain the content that is displayed to Web site users based on the role assigned by Web site administrators. The RoleGroup class is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to associate a content template with a set of roles.
To dynamically assign a template to the role group, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContentTemplate%2A> property to a reference to an object that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> interface.
You must configure role management to use the RoleGroup class. For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example assigns a custom template to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContentTemplate%2A> property.
[!code-vb[RoleGroupClass#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_111_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[RoleGroupClass#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_111_1.aspx)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ContainsUser(class System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal user) cil managed

Docs.param: The user name to look for in the role group.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the specified user is a member of any of the roles in the role group.
Docs.returns: if the user is a member of one of the roles associated with this role group; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ContainsUser method returns `true` if the specified user is a member of any of the roles associated with this role group. Roles are searched in the order they are listed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.Roles%2A> property, and searching stops after the first match is found.
This method uses the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.IsUserInRole%2A> method to determine whether a user is a member of a role. You must configure role management to use the ContainsUser method. For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content template associated with this role group.
Docs.value: The associated with this role group. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ContentTemplate property contains the content that is displayed to users who are members of this role group.
## Examples The following code example dynamically creates a content template.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the roles associated with this role group.
Docs.value: A comma-separated list of roles associated with this role group. The default is .

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Returns a comma-separated list of the roles associated with this role group.
Docs.returns: A comma-separated list of the roles associated with this role group.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToString method returns the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.Roles%2A> property as a comma-separated list of roles associated with the role group.
